intro: Boscia homblei, commonly known as the red bushwillow, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. Boscia homblei is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
